message.content:
<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
try {
    response.setContentType("text/plain");
    response.setHeader("Content-Disposition", "attachment; filename=hint.txt;");
    PrintWriter writer = response.getWriter();
    writer.write(expl);
    writer.flush();
} catch (Exception e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
}
<<<explanation>>>: The problem is that you are using ObjectOutputStream to write your text to the response. ObjectOutputStream is used for writing serialized objects, not plain text. It adds some metadata at the beginning of the stream, which is what you are seeing as unexpected characters. Instead, you should use PrintWriter to write your text to the response. This will not add any additional metadata, so the output will be exactly what you expect.
